title: Cash, beaker set, motherboard seized: ISIS-inspired module busted; suspects were planning 'IED attacks'
content: Delhi Police have reportedly dismantled an 'IS-inspired' module, arresting suspects across Delhi, Ranchi, and Mumbai. The suspects were allegedly planning IED attacks to establish an Islamic Caliphate. Authorities seized bomb-making materials, including chemicals and electronic components. Investigations suggest an ISI operative posed as an IS recruiter, guiding the suspects through encrypted apps.

title: Aishwarya Rai gets relief: Delhi HC bars misuse of name, photos
content: The Delhi High Court has come down heavily on the unauthorized use of Bollywood actor Aishwarya Rai Bachchan's name, image, and persona, holding that such exploitation without consent not only causes commercial detriment but also impacts her dignity and reputation.

title: Asia Cup | More than just cricket! Gill hugged UAE player after hitting winning runs
content: In a heartwarming reunion at the Asia Cup 2025, Shubman Gill, India's rising cricket star, shared a special moment with UAE's Simranjeet Singh. Years ago, Simranjeet had bowled to a young Gill in Mohali. After Gill sealed India's victory with a boundary off Simranjeet's bowling, he embraced his former practice partner.

title: Delhi-Kathmandu SpiceJet flight delayed: Passengers exit sweltering cabin
content: SpiceJet passengers on a Delhi-Kathmandu flight faced discomfort after a technical snag caused air conditioning failure, leading to delays and eventual disembarkation. This incident follows a similar Air India ordeal where over 200 Singapore-bound passengers were stranded in a malfunctioning Boeing 787-9 Dreamliner for two hours.

title: Gemini app tops 10M users: Nano Banana fuels buzz; viral prompts to try
content: Google's Gemini app, featuring the AI image editing tool Nano Banana, has achieved over 10 million downloads shortly after its launch. Users have already created or modified over 200 million images, leveraging Nano Banana's speed and accuracy. Viral trends showcase the tool's versatility, allowing users to transform themselves into action figures, appear in different decades, and step into famous artworks.

title: 'Match must go on': SC refuses urgent hearing of PIL; India vs Pak to continue
content: The Supreme Court refused to urgently list a PIL seeking to cancel the India vs. Pakistan cricket match scheduled for the Asia Cup in Dubai. The petition, filed by law students, cited recent political tensions and terror attacks, arguing the match would compromise national dignity.

title: CRPF flags Rahul Gandhi‚Äôs foreign trips, cites serious security concerns
content: The CRPF has expressed worries about repeated security protocol breaches by Rahul Gandhi during his international travels, potentially increasing his risk exposure. Despite having Z+ security cover, Gandhi has reportedly skipped necessary safety measures on multiple occasions. The CRPF has urged adherence to security guidelines, emphasizing that violations weaken VVIP protection.

title: Parents shield kids, students scatter ‚Äî Video shows chaos as Charlie Kirk shot on stage
content: During a "Prove Me Wrong" event at Utah University, right-wing activist Charlie Kirk was shot, causing widespread panic. The incident occurred while Kirk addressed a question about transgender mass shooting suspects, turning a campus debate into a scene of terror. Witnesses described the chaos as attendees scrambled for safety, highlighting concerns about security at the event.

title: Amazon's money reset: CEO ditches Jeff Bezos' failed bets; this is his new plan
content: Amazon CEO Andy Jassy has abandoned Jeff Bezos' costly experimental spending strategy, learning from billion-dollar failures like the Fire Phone and failed healthcare ventures. Jassy now focuses Amazon's investments on fewer, profitable projects rather than hundreds of moonshot bets. This strategic shift has driven Amazon's stock up 30% and boosted profits five-fold since the post-pandemic recovery.

title: Why an India vs Pakistan final has never happened in Asia Cup
content: The highly anticipated India-Pakistan cricket clash at the Asia Cup 2025 in Dubai on September 14 is generating immense excitement. Historically, India has dominated high-stakes encounters, particularly in ICC tournaments and Asia Cups. Despite never meeting in an Asia Cup final, India holds a superior head-to-head record, winning 10 of 18 matches against Pakistan.

title: Woman tied up, stabbed to death by 2 domestic helps in Hyderabad flat
content: In Kukatpally, Hyderabad, a shocking incident occurred where a 50-year-old woman was murdered in her apartment by two domestic helpers. The perpetrators, after tying up and stabbing Renu Agarwal, stole gold jewelry and cash. They fled the scene on a two-wheeler, prompting a police manhunt to apprehend them, with suspicion pointing towards Ranchi as a possible escape destination.

title: Raipur airport navigation system fails, flights hit; hundreds of passengers stranded
content: Flight operations at Raipur's Swami Vivekananda Airport faced disruptions on Thursday morning due to a navigation system malfunction, leading to flight cancellations and passenger inconvenience. Airport Director KK Lahre confirmed the technical glitch, with operational work underway to resolve the issue. A passenger, Shantanu Chakraborthy, expressed frustration over his cancelled flight to Kolkata, highlighting the widespread disruption.

title: Trump aide killed: Musk calls attack chilling, ‚ÄòShows what we‚Äôre dealing with‚Äô
content: Right-wing activist Charlie Kirk was reportedly shot dead in a targeted attack at Utah Valley University, prompting strong reactions. Elon Musk condemned the act as a "cold-blooded murder," criticizing those celebrating the incident and accusing the left of promoting violence.

title: 'Progress being made': Govt says India-US trade deal likely by Nov; Trump-Modi signal thaw
content: Union Minister Piyush Goyal announced that the initial phase of the trade agreement between India and the United States is expected to be finalized by November 2025. Discussions are progressing positively, with both sides expressing satisfaction, he said.

title: Sunjay Kapur‚Äôs sister accuses Priya Kapur of taking everything
content: Karisma Kapoor's children are seeking their share of their late father Sunjay Kapur's estate in the Delhi High Court, escalating a family dispute. Sunjay's sister accuses his widow of seizing everything, leaving their mother without resources. The court has ordered a full asset disclosure, with the next hearing scheduled for October 9 to potentially resolve the inheritance dispute.

title: Asia Cup: Suryakumar better captain than Rohit, Kohli, Dhoni - numbers prove it
content: India dominated UAE in their Asia Cup opener, securing a nine-wicket victory after Kuldeep Yadav's exceptional spin bowling dismantled the hosts for a mere 57 runs. India chased down the target swiftly in just 4.3 overs. Kuldeep Yadav's impressive figures of 4 for 7 led the bowling attack, supported by Shivam Dube's career-best 3/4.

title: Beast mauls, MP woman strikes back: 65-year-old strangles Jackal with sari
content: Surajia Bai Jatav, a 65-year-old woman from Madhya Pradesh, bravely fought off a jackal that attacked her in her field. The fierce encounter lasted for thirty minutes, during which she strangled the animal to death with her sari.

title: PF withdrawals by ATM, seamless transactions: EPFO may rollout benefits before Diwali
content: The EPFO is set to deliberate on the EPFO 3.0 initiative, potentially enabling partial PF withdrawals via ATMs or using them via UPI. Discussions will also include a proposal to increase the minimum monthly pension to between Rs 1,500 and Rs 2,500.

title: Trade deal: India‚Äôs chief negotiator may travel to US next week; Modi-Trump call soon
content: Amidst easing tensions, India and the US are set to resume trade talks, signaled by positive exchanges between Prime Minister Modi and President Trump. Chief trade negotiator Rajesh Agarwal will travel to Washington for discussions, though uncertainty remains regarding potential US tariff concessions.

title: Sanjay Kapur estate war: 'Real fight between Priya and Karisma'
content: The legal battle over Sunjay Kapur's estate intensifies as his mother, Rani Kapur, voices concerns about the will's authenticity and undisclosed asset sales. Her lawyer clarified the dispute primarily involves Karisma Kapoor and Priya Sachdeva. The Delhi High Court is reviewing the case after Karisma's children challenged the will, alleging forgery.

title: Solar Eclipse September 2025: Who will see it, and will the UAE miss out?
content: A partial solar eclipse will occur on September 21, 2025, marking the final solar eclipse of the year. The event will be visible only in parts of the Southern Hemisphere, including New Zealand, eastern Australia, and Antarctica. It will not be visible in the UAE, Asia, or the Americas. The eclipse coincides closely with the September equinox.

title: Viral Video: Woman dancing with shirtless Salman not Bigg Boss 19 contestant Kunickaa
content: Salman Khan, hosting Bigg Boss 19, faces controversy over alleged favoritism towards contestant Kunickaa Sadanand. An old video resurfaced, falsely identified Kunickaa dancing with Salman, fueling bias claims. The woman is actually choreographer Pony Verma, Prakash Raj's wife, unrelated to Kunickaa's current Bigg Boss stint. Other contestants include Gaurav Khanna, Amaal Mallik and Ashnoor Kaur.

title: 'Circumstances similar': Udit Raj likens Nepal turmoil to India; BJP hits back
content: Congress leader Udit Raj drew parallels between Nepal's recent political turmoil and potential scenarios in India, referencing Sri Lanka and Bangladesh. He asserted that while similar conditions exist, India's robust Constitution and deeply rooted democracy, established by the Congress party, prevent such overthrows. This statement follows violent Gen Z-led protests in Nepal that led to significant political upheaval.

title: A gunshot, then screams: How assassination of Trump loyalist Charlie Kirk unfolded
content: Conservative activist Charlie Kirk was fatally shot while speaking at Utah Valley University, prompting a campus lockdown. Donald Trump mourned Kirk, calling him a "martyr" for conservative values. The incident occurred during a Q&A session, and witnesses described chaos as Kirk was shot in the neck. While initial reports suggested an arrest, the suspect remains at large, according to officials.

title: Watch: Nepal ministers, kin hold on to chopper rope to escape
content: Nepal is facing a severe political crisis as violent protests erupted in Kathmandu following a social media ban, leading to Prime Minister Oli's resignation. Ministers and their families were evacuated by army helicopters amidst public anger, with videos showing dramatic escapes.

title: Enhanced Games: Olympics medallist joins multi-sport event where drugs are legal
content: British Olympic medalist Ben Proud is set to participate in the Enhanced Games, a controversial event allowing performance-enhancing drugs, scheduled for May 2026 in Las Vegas. Proud's decision means he will be banned from international competitions. The Enhanced Games will feature swimming, sprinting, and weightlifting, with substantial cash prizes for winners and record-breakers.

title: Charlie Kirk opposed H-1B visas; claimed Indians ‚Äòdisplaced‚Äô American workers
content: Conservative commentator Charlie Kirk, known for his controversial views, was fatally shot in Utah. His death follows recent remarks criticizing Indian professionals in the US workforce, claiming they displace American workers. Kirk's comments echoed concerns from figures like Laura Ingraham regarding H-1B visas and trade deals with India, sparking debate amid existing tensions over immigration and outsourcing policies.

title: 'Political assassination': Trump loyalist Charlie Kirk shot dead; key points
content: Conservative activist Charlie Kirk was fatally shot during a speaking event at Utah Valley University, prompting a campus lockdown and a widespread search for the suspect. President Trump mourned Kirk's death, ordering flags to be flown at half-mast. The incident sparked condemnation from political leaders across the spectrum, highlighting concerns about political violence.

title: Nasa finds 'clearest sign' yet of life on Mars in crater rock
content: NASA's Perseverance rover has potentially discovered the strongest evidence yet of ancient life on Mars. The Cheyava Falls rock sample, collected from Jezero Crater, exhibits unusual leopard spot markings and contains organic compounds. Scientists believe these features could represent biosignatures resulting from microbial activity billions of years ago, though further research is needed to confirm this groundbreaking possibility.

title: 'Left my mother without a roof': Sunjay Kapur‚Äôs sister says Priya took everything
content: Reacting to Bollywood actor Karisma Kapoor's children's plea in Delhi High Court seeking a share in their late father Sunjay Kapur's Rs 30,000 crore estate, the businessman's sister Mandhira Kapur Smith said that the wealth was supposed to be distributed equally among the families, but "one person [Sunjay Kapur's widow Priya Sachdeva Kapur] has come in and taken everything."

title: IND vs UAE: Towel drama in Asia Cup! Third umpire rules OUT, but Suryakumar withdraws appeal
content: In an Asia Cup 2025 match, India defeated UAE by 9 wickets after Suryakumar Yadav withdrew an appeal, showing sportsmanship. UAE were bundled out for a mere 57, with Kuldeep Yadav claiming 4 wickets for 7 runs. Jasprit Bumrah's yorker dismissed UAE's top scorer, Alishan Sharafu.

title: Watch: Denied wheelchair, man drags father at govt hospital in Coimbatore
content: Coimbatore Medical College Hospital suspended two contract supervisors after a man was forced to carry his elderly father due to a lack of wheelchair assistance. Allegations of a staff member demanding money for a wheelchair surfaced, prompting an inquiry.

title: Asia Cup, IND vs UAE: Abhishek joins Rohit Sharma in exclusive T20I list
content: India initiated their 2025 Men's Asia Cup campaign with a dominant nine-wicket victory over the UAE, fueled by Abhishek Sharma's explosive batting. Chasing a modest target, India completed the chase in a record-breaking 4.3 overs. Kuldeep Yadav's exceptional four-wicket haul and Shivam Dube's three wickets restricted UAE to a mere 57.

title: Sikandar actor reacts to AR Murugadoss' remark that he waited 8 hours for Salman Khan
content: Ayaan Lall, Salman Khan's co-star, defended the actor against AR Murugadoss's claims. He dismissed allegations of Salman being late on set. Ayaan praised Salman's character and charity work during the Punjab floods. He clarified Salman's arrival time and responsibilities. Ayaan highlighted Salman's consideration for the crew. He acknowledged the challenges of working with a superstar.

title: 'Officials seen wiping out traces': Kim Jong Un's daughter next in line? What we know
content: South Korean lawmakers suggest Kim Jong Un is positioning his daughter, Kim Ju Ae, as his successor, evident after their recent China visit, including the SCO Summit. First appearing publicly in 2022, she's attended high-profile events and is hailed in state media. Believed to be 13, Ju Ae enjoys hobbies and home-schooling.

title: Heart health: Cardiologist shares ‚Äòsigns‚Äô of heart failure you might be ignoring
content: Heart failure often starts subtly, with symptoms like fatigue, breathlessness, and swelling easily dismissed as stress or aging. Recognizing these early signs, summarized by the FACES acronym (Fatigue, Activity limitations, Congestion, Edema, Shortness of breath), is crucial. Prompt medical attention and lifestyle adjustments can significantly improve outcomes for those at risk.

title: US dreams shuddering? Working in the US won't be the same for Indians; here is why
content: A viral video of an Indian DoorDash worker highlights the emotional strain many Indian immigrants face in the US, caught between personal aspirations and societal exclusion. Despite forming the backbone of America‚Äôs STEM workforce, contributing to innovation, academia, and entrepreneurship, Indian professionals increasingly confront hostility, marginalization, and anti-immigrant rhetoric, revealing the paradox of reliance on talent amid growing suspicion.

title: Benny Johnson remembers how Charlie Kirk sheltered his family - an unheard story
content: Benny Johnson, a conservative commentator, recounted a harrowing experience on Fox News where a fire and nearby shooting threatened his family shortly after DC's police defunding. He revealed that Charlie Kirk generously offered his Florida condo to Johnson, his wife, and their newborn, providing refuge while they searched for a new home. Johnson credits Kirk's selfless act for his family's current stability and home in Florida.

title: RJD leader Rajkumar Rai shot dead outside his house; 6 bullet shells recovered
content: In Patna, an RJD functionary and businessman, Rajkumar Rai, was fatally shot near Rajendra Nagar Terminal. Police investigations are underway, with the driver being questioned and nearby eyewitnesses' statements recorded. Six empty cartridges were found at the crime scene, and authorities are reviewing security cameras in the area to gather more information.

title: UP: Pregnant deaf-mute woman dies days after gang rape
content: A 26-year-old pregnant, speech and hearing-impaired woman, a rape survivor, tragically died during treatment in Kanpur after being gang-raped in Hamirpur. The two accused villagers, who had previously raped her leading to the pregnancy, are now in custody following the woman's death. Police have registered a case and are conducting investigations, including a postmortem examination.

title: Elon Musk regains richest title from Larry Ellison; see their net worth
content: Oracle's Larry Ellison briefly surpassed Elon Musk as the world's wealthiest person on Wednesday due to a surge in Oracle's stock price following a strong earnings report. The report highlighted significant customer orders in AI technology, boosting Ellison's wealth by $100 billion in thirty minutes.

title: Charlie Kirk assassination: Bullet struck as Trump ally spoke on gang violence; his chilling last words
content: Conservative activist Charlie Kirk, a prominent Trump ally, was fatally shot at a Utah Valley University event while discussing gun violence. Kirk's final words, "Counting or not counting gang violence?", highlighted the irony. Donald Trump mourned Kirk's death, calling it an "assassination" and praising him as a patriot. The incident occurred during a Q&A session, sparking widespread shock and grief.

title: Delhi airport: 200 flyers left sweating as Singapore-bound Boeing's electricals fail
content: Over 200 passengers on an Air India flight to Singapore faced a distressing ordeal at Delhi airport. Due to malfunctioning air conditioning and electrical systems on Wednesday night, passengers were stuck inside the Boeing 787-9 Dreamliner for nearly two hours. The discomfort led to passengers using newspapers as fans before being deplaned.

title: Bullet came from rooftop? Key Trump ally fatally shot at college campus - 10 things to know
content: Conservative activist Charlie Kirk, a close ally of US President Donald Trump, was fatally shot during a campus event in Utah. Utah's governor called it a political assassination. Kirk, 31, was speaking at Utah Valley University when he was shot in the neck and later died. The incident prompted widespread condemnation and flags were ordered to be flown at half-staff.

content: the fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around MLB . payton Tolle was originally scheduled to start today's game in Sacramento with the Boston Red Sox attempting to sweep the Athletics .

title: WBC reveals championship ring for Canelo vs. Crawford fight
content: the undisputed super middleweight title fight between canelo alvarez and challenger Terence Crawford has a key piece of jewelry at stake . the ring, designed by WBC strategic partner Rasheen Farlow, is valued at over $100,000 . a collection of green stones makes up the trademark green belt in the center .

title: How competition -- in everything -- drives Crawford ahead of Canelo fight
content: TERENCE CRAWFORD 's EXISTENCE revolves around proving people wrong . terence crawfORD is a former two-division undisputed champion . it's not just winning at boxing, but at table tennis, chess, video games .

title: What makes a baseball player exciting? We asked two rising MLB stars
content: a baseball player bracket skews young, with the average age (26.4) more than two years younger than the MLB average (28.6) . the bracket embodies several common qualities among our 32 entrants . "i just like seeing guys who can do a lot of different things on the field," says a representative .

title: World Cup onside/offside: Good win for USMNT, last dance for Lionel Messi?
content: Mauricio Pochettino tinkered both in strategy and lineup to improve the agile, high-possession mentality of hajime Moriyasu's Japan . he went back to the playbook from his Southampton and Tottt . this week's world cup qualifiers took center stage .

title: Fantasy reaction: Bigsby trade a boon to Etienne's fantasy value
content: fantasy football buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around the NFL . quarterback Brock Purdy is no expected to play in Week 2 due to toe and shoulder injuries suffered in Week 1 . head coach Kyle Shanahan says his absence could stretch beyond this week .

title: MMA divisional rankings: How much did Nassourdine Imavov rise at middleweight?
content: Nassourdine Imavov beats caio Borralho in the uFC Fight Night main event . he moves up to no. 3 in the latest ESPN middleweight rankings . the other weight class in which rankings change is heavyweight, where Marcin Tybura drops out of the top 10 .

title: Survivor pool strategy: The top teams to take in Week 2
content: ESPN Eliminator Challenge is one of the most fun and simple games to play this season . the rules are simple: pick one team, and as long as they win (or tie), you advance to the next round . if they lose, you are out .

title: 'Nacua must mix his oatmeal with cement': Rams can't overstate WR's importance
content: los Angeles Rams wide receiver Davante Adams saw the collision in the middle of the field . he was taken to the locker room after a concussion and receiving stitches . the third-year receiver finished with 10 catches for 130 yards, by far the leading receiver .

title: Matchup rankings: Drake Maye, Ricky Pearsall stand out in Week 2
content: the matchup rankings provide a schedule-independent method to evaluate positional matchups each week . each defense fared relative to the difficulty of the schedule it has faced . for the first three weeks, these rankings are entirely my opinion of how favorable october .

title: Potential managerial and front office changes on the horizon
content: snitker will turn 70 next month . he'll move into a role with the team's front office . his son is now a hitting coach for the Houston Astros . the braves signed him to a free agent contract in 1977 .

title: Pulisic rates 9/10 as win vs. Japan gets USMNT back on track
content: alejandro Zendejas and Folarin Balogun both score as the united states defeats Japan 2-0 . the men's national team quickly bounced back with a more proactive attack through an experimental 3-4-3 formation . in a first half, the home side created danger through high-pressing fullbacks Max Arfsten and Alex Freeman .

title: Bottom 10: The spitting distance between Florida and Arizona State
content: "Spitting off the Edge of the World" is here at Bottom 10 Headquarters . Pat McAfee donates all the sleeves that he cuts off his shishi . "we're spitting off the edge of the world, out in the night Never had no chance, nowhere to hide"

title: NFL execs predict the biggest award winners: Picks for MVP, best rookies, more
content: a half-dozen teams look primed for a triumphant march to Levi's Stadium on febr. 8 for super Bowl LX . the road to the playoffs is rarely linear; championships require individual brilliance from star players . from MVP to rookie of the year, few of the major awards offer clear consensus .
